alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 10:24AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: Light to moderate snowfall will continue throughout the day across much of Carbon County including the Interstate 80 corridor from Rawlins to Elk Mountain. Widespread snowfall around 1 inch will be possible for most locations. Heavier amounts up to 3 inches will be possible near Elk Mountain as well as in southwest Carbon County near Baggs along the western slopes of the Sierra Madres. Use caution if traveling as periods of moderate snowfall could significantly reduce visibility and create slick road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
